algorithm_technique: Graph traversal (DFS/BFS) starting from an endpoint to reconstruct the array.
problem_summary_simple: Reconstruct an array given pairs of adjacent elements.
problem_summary_technical: Build an adjacency list graph from pairs, find an endpoint, and traverse to reconstruct the array.
key_insights: The problem can be modeled as finding a path in a graph where numbers are nodes and adjacent pairs are edges.
The elements with only one neighbor in the adjacency list are the endpoints of the original array.
A simple traversal (like DFS or iterative construction) from an endpoint can reconstruct the array.
